Hi: How do I get rid of old kernels after I am done updating my kernel?
I know how to delete the entry in the boot menu
I want to remove unwanted kernels
open synaptic package manager and find them and un-install them.. its always good to leave at least one other incase the newer kernel doesnt work right you have a fallback

in synaptic package manager, search for "linux-image-" and you should find checked ones like "linux-image-2.6.32-xx-generic" etc.. uncheck the ones you want to remove and apply, they will dissapear from your grub menu automatically then
